title: Gerard Butler suing the driver who ran him off the road in 2017 motorcycle accident
text:
Two years after he was involved in a motorcycle accident, Gerard Butler is suing the other driver.

The 49-year-old actor filed a lawsuit against a woman who he claims cut him off in traffic which caused him to crash back in October of 2017, according to TMZ on Thursday.

Sources said that his injuries weren't severe at the time of the collision, however, in the new lawsuit Butler claims that he suffered a great deal.

Seeking justice: Two years after he was involved in a motorcycle accident, Gerard Butler is suing the other driver claiming he suffered 'catastrophic injuries,' according to TMZ on Thursday (Pictured in August)

According to the documents, the Angel Has Fallen actor said he was thrown from his motorcycle after the other driver 'negligently pulled her vehicle off the curb.'

He alleges that she then 'cut across lanes of traffic directly in front of him' in her Mercedes Benz.

The move apparently left Butler no time to hit the brakes so he ended up crashing into the woman's driver's side which propelled him off his Triumph motorcycle.

Gerard said he suffered 'catastrophic injuries' as a result of being run off the road and he is now suing for unspecified damages.

Accusations: The 49-year-old actor filed the lawsuit against a woman who he claims cut him off in traffic after she 'negligently pulled her vehicle off the curb' which caused him to crash back 2017 (Pictured Sept 2017 on the same vehicle involved in the crash)

Back when the incident happened, an insider told TMZ: 'Lucky for him no broken bones just cuts and bruises.'

They added: 'Someone called 911, paramedics came and took Gerard to a nearby hospital where he was treated for his injuries.'

Butler himself addressed his injuries following the incident and told Entertainment Tonight that he had fractured his foot in several places and had quite a bit of bruising.

Lucky to be alive: Butler is seeking unspecified damages according to the documents

'It made me really appreciate how precious life is because I could have landed any number of ways that would have taken me out.'

When he recollected the incident to ET, he said that the woman made an illegal U-turn and the subsequent crash sent him 'flying through the air' and then smashing into the ground.

'I have five fractures in my right foot alone [and] a bunch of stupid stuff, a torn meniscus, but I'll be fine,' he said at the time.
description: Two years after he was involved in a motorcycle accident, Gerard Butler is suing the other driver claiming he suffered 'catastrophic injuries.'
